channel.title: generate(shmup);
channel.description:
I ported Dave Bollinger's [url='https://www.davebollinger.com/works/pixelspaceships/']Pixel Spaceships[/url] algorithm to GML and made a simple game out of it. In a nutshell, it uses 32 bit seeds to create a 12x12 spaceship.
I took it a step further and made it work with 4 different ship shapes.
The ship formations are also randomly generated.
[img]https://img194.imageshack.us/img194/5633/ssplay.png[/img] [img]https://img193.imageshack.us/img193/9449/ssboss.png[/img]
[url=https://www.box.net/shared/iqoha1fbch]Download generate(shump);[/url][/size]
Music by flip :slight_smile:
- Z and arrow keys
- Added edge formations to make sure you don't hide there - Bosses drop powerups, which heal 2 and give you additional shot - You loose shot power when you're hit
It's a little game I made this summer. Next step is to expand the algorithm to and combine it with a sound wave analyzer to make a music game.
Here are a few other goodies I made. A 1024x600 spread of ships, displayed x2
[img]https://img442.imageshack.us/img442/9660/wallpaper3.png[/img]
Then I made a couple wallpapers. Also 1024x600, but that should be very easy to adjust.
[img]https://img442.imageshack.us/img442/4051/wallpaper14t.png[/img]
[img]https://img442.imageshack.us/img442/7863/wallpaper15.png[/img]
